Text:
Last year, the Asian American community saw a 339% rise in hate crimes. To all the victims and families who have been impacted: I'll never stop working to protect you.

We are not the "other." We must #StopAsianHate.
https://t.co/iTJ38f9vpU

Today marks two years since Ahmaud Arbery was chased and shot down for jogging while Black.

While his murderers are rightfully convicted, Ahmaud should be alive today. That would be true justice.

In his name, we renew our call that #BlackLivesMatter. https://t.co/fXXQ1pkMwb

This #BlackHistoryMonth, a reminder: if Roe v. Wade is overturned, it’s Black women who will face some of the harshest barriers to reproductive care.

It's time to codify Roe.

Ahmaud Arbery's murder was a vicious hate crime that represented a modern day lynching. I commend the Arbery family, particularly Ms. Wanda Cooper-Jones, for their strength and determination in making sure these racist murderers were tried and convicted for *all* of their crimes. https://t.co/airicjvwp5

Putin's malign actions against Ukraine are threatening innocent lives and regional stability in Europe, and I fully support the additional sanctions @POTUS announced today. My full statement: https://t.co/7gco3aiPlz

This President's Day is a great day to thank our @POTUS for all he's done to deliver a better America.
 
Checks in pockets.
Historic job growth.
Record low unemployment.
A bipartisan blueprint for safer roads and cleaner drinking water. https://t.co/Me9E4oojNk

By passing my Korematsu-Takai Civil Liberties Protection Act, we can help confront our past and send a clear message that our nation is committed to preventing civil rights violations of our fellow Americans from ever happening again. https://t.co/P1JiMAktcc

This dark chapter reminds us of our work to defend constitutional rights & uproot anti-Asian hate that, even to this day, continues to terrorize the AANHPI community. We must finally pass my Korematsu-Takai Civil Liberties Protection Act to prevent history from repeating itself. https://t.co/oL327aLmsw

80 years ago, the U.S. government adopted Executive Order 9066 which wrongfully interned more than 120k innocent Japanese Americans within our own borders during WWII. This was a grave mistake, and our nation has a solemn duty to ensure this national travesty never happens again. https://t.co/BH4ULvtvBH

Improving infrastructure means helping families everywhere have access to clean drinking water. I'm glad @MitchLandrieu46 joined us in Waukegan today to share how the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will help improve the Great Lakes, ensure safer drinking water & protect jobs. https://t.co/8qgZwmTXTd
We’d swoop down low, lower our speed and drop them out over the desert near locations where we saw kids. Inspired by the original “candy bomber.” https://t.co/mzzJym0pG9

Gail Halvorsen inspired my generation and we also dropped candy bombs with candy, volleyballs and school supplies to Iraqi children during our service. May he rest in peace.
https://t.co/m2Dw5Qx69q

As a founding co-chair of the Senate’s first-ever Environmental Justice Caucus, I applaud @BrendaMallory46 for today’s launch of the @WHCEQ EJ Screening Tool. This mapping tool is an important part of our ongoing work to advance @POTUS's #Justice40 Initiative. https://t.co/rqyHu3eNAB

Reports like these are one of the reasons I helped @SenAmyKlobuchar and @CongressmanRaja introduce the Baby Food Safety Act last year, and why I’ll continue working with my colleagues and @US_FDA to make sure what we feed our children will help them grow up safe and healthy.

Folks it’s simple—parents deserve the peace of mind knowing that the baby and toddler food they purchase is safe, nutritious and free of harmful contents. 

The latest information from Consumer Reports about toxic heavy metals in baby foods is troubling. https://t.co/DNkcFL03dw

I’m very troubled by the situation in Ukraine and Russia’s continuing escalation of tensions. Proud to join this bipartisan group to send a clear message: the US supports Ukraine’s self-determination and stands strong against Putin’s unwarranted aggression.https://t.co/UiUTd9AvEJ
I’m monitoring this terribly dangerous situation. I hope everyone stays safe and encourage all affected to follow emergency personnel guidance. https://t.co/vPKhBkf9Y1

We need a long term storage solution for nuclear waste, but the Great Lakes region—a vital water resource for millions of Americans—should not be it. Proud to join this resolution because I’m committed to doing all I can to protect our water. ⬇

https://t.co/8Kgofyh5ya

NEWS: The Senate Small Business Committee passed my bipartisan bill to help level the playing field for women business owners by making sure they have access to resources across federal agencies.

Now, let's get it to the Senate floor for final passage! https://t.co/fF2NFMFTeI

A good reminder for expecting mothers: vaccines provide strong protection for pregnant women and their babies. Please, get vaccinated and boosted.

Visit https://t.co/4Hmb8dJOrL to find a location near you. https://t.co/2rFYkbCHpv

Three years ago in Aurora, Illinois, a gunman murdered five of his former coworkers and wounded five first responders doing their jobs.

While my heart is heavy today, we know what we must do to honor the victims.

We have to act to end preventable gun violence. Enough is enough.

In a little over a year, the U.S. economy has recovered 87% of the 22 million jobs lost due to the pandemic.

Despite Republican obstructionism, Democrats and our policies are delivering real results for working Americans everywhere.

No school should be better known for the blood that was shed in its classrooms than the curriculum taught there. I’m holding the survivors & victims' families of the Marjory Stoneman Douglas shooting in my heart today.

Action to end our nation's gun violence epidemic can’t wait. https://t.co/73h1CUNAQV
On Valentine's Day, women deserve more than roses. We deserve equal pay for equal work too.

It's simple, folks: by getting fully vaccinated, your chances of being hospitalized with COVID are significantly lower.

Get vaccinated. 
Get boosted. 
Get protected.
https://t.co/ApwsfKO0WQ

It’s always great to have @SecretaryPete in Illinois! I was glad to have him join me, @SenatorDurbin and @GovPritzker at @Heartland_CC to learn more about how we’re making Illinois a leader in electric vehicle manufacturing and training. https://t.co/5FLlkWxsHK

Happy birthday to President Lincoln, an Illinoisan whose vision moved our nation closer towards that more perfect Union. Let today serve as a reminder for all of us to live our lives by his words "with malice toward none and charity for all.” https://t.co/gdR2cjjd4R

Ensuring the site of the Springfield Race Riot in Illinois is memorialized is one way we can honor the work the NAACP is doing today.

Black history is American history, and I'll do all I can to preserve it for generations to come. https://t.co/T5HdqzEYnR

The Springfield Race Riot was a tragedy that gave way to a historic organization dedicated to building a better tomorrow for all, and it should not go unrecognized or be forgotten.
 
That's why I'm proud to be working with @SenatorDurbin to make the riot site a national monument. https://t.co/mK0KXGCv3I

In 1908, white residents in Springfield torched hundreds of homes and businesses of Black Illinoisans and murdered six—simply because of the color of their skin.
 
After this horrific tragedy, determined citizens banded together and set out to form the NAACP. https://t.co/YVayPPYj4w

Despite so many in power resisting their efforts, the @NAACP has been a leading defender of civil rights, racial justice and equality in our country for 113 years.

And while their story is long and winding, it started in Illinois after the Springfield Race Riot. https://t.co/aurmv9roFs

In the years since Trump abandoned the JCPOA, the threat of Iran developing a nuclear weapon has increased, not decreased. In order to truly advance US security interests, we should do everything we can to find a viable diplomatic solution that prevents an Iranian nuclear weapon.

All across our nation, the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will make a huge difference in our work to remove lead pipes and deliver cleaner water to more families thanks to my Drinking Water and Wastewater Infrastructure Act being included. Clean water is a right. https://t.co/qX4VzojGgK
So glad we got this done. Once signed into law, this change will help survivors of sexual harassment and assault be heard and have their day in court. https://t.co/YVaXE4bZhh

Thanks to the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, key players like @cmapillinois have more support as we work to update our water infrastructure, make transit more accessible and support local jobs.

It was great chatting yesterday! Together, we'll build a better future for Illinois. https://t.co/QsbJSh35dX

At https://t.co/MA527I95FY, deported Veterans and their families can also find a new portal where they can easily get in touch with @DHSgov as they seek assistance in returning to the United States or accessing the VA benefits they’ve earned.

Great news! The Biden Admin launched a new one-stop resource center so our immigrant servicemembers can more easily find the forms and resources they need from @DHSgov, @DeptofDefense or @DeptVetAffairs all in one place.
 
🗣Share widely: https://t.co/MA527I95FY

VAWA has been reauthorized three times since 1994 with bipartisan support—and there's no reason it shouldn't be now.

Victims of domestic violence can't wait. It's time to #SupportSurvivors and pass a renewed VAWA.

For years, 34 chimpanzees—that are no longer needed for government research—have been held on the Holloman Air Force Base in New Mexico in clear violation of federal law and humane treatment.

Today, I'm introducing the bipartisan Chimp Sanctuary Act to right this wrong. https://t.co/OGEnhXaeDf

To learn from our past, the National Park Service must preserve our whole history—even our darkest chapters.

I’m with @SenatorBennet. We must pass his bipartisan bill to preserve the infamous Camp Amache, where thousands of Japanese Americans were unjustly interned. https://t.co/t58KR13si4

I’m proud to introduce the bipartisan DEMAND Act with @SenThomTillis, @RepUnderwood and @RepJohnKatko to help nursing moms access what they need to breastfeed under FEMA when disaster strikes.

It’s a simple, common-sense solution to help families in times of crisis. https://t.co/cuyIAFeFTk
This Tweet from @SenDuckworth has been withheld in response to a report from the copyright holder. Learn more.

In one year, we've seen wages climb 5.7%.

That's nearly double the average of about 3% before the pandemic hit.

The Biden Boom is the real deal, folks.

Few can say they had the opportunity to showcase their talents on the world stage in the Olympics, and for that—each and every one of these Illinoisans should be proud. Congratulations! I'm rooting for you. 
https://t.co/Dlf4aGFdoA

29 years after the FMLA gave new parents up to 12 weeks of unpaid leave, there's still so much work to do to lift up working families and empower them to succeed at work and at home.

We can make paid leave a reality by passing the FAMILY Act. Let's get it done.

Thanks to @POTUS, 14.5 million Americans have signed up to receive quality, affordable healthcare under the ACA—nearly 2 million more than ever before.

This is yet another way Democrats are giving more families better peace of mind and expanding access to life-saving care.
If employees anywhere want to unionize, they should be able to do that without fear—and that includes Congressional staffers who work hard to serve their state and their nation.

Glad the Biden Admin’s new guidance makes it crystal clear: Americans with disabilities have a right to healthcare, even during this ongoing pandemic.

Together, we must keep doing all we can to remove the barriers to equity that the disability community endure to this day. https://t.co/67bZbIaat2

She didn't know it then, but Rosa Parks ignited a fierce movement for equal justice by refusing to move on that bus in Montgomery, Alabama. On what would've been her 109th birthday, that movement continues and in her memory, let's keep working for justice—just like she taught us. https://t.co/kkSKP7vKQP

Even amid the terrible Omicron wave, the Biden boom added another 467,000 jobs to the economy in January. 

Under Democrats' leadership, the economy is defying odds and doing better than experts expected.

And it's only the beginning. 
https://t.co/atAH1ZctlT

Reminder: over 150 years after the 15th amendment was ratified, Republicans continue to block legislation that would help protect the right to vote for people of color in the face of Jim Crow 2.0.

Our work on voting rights is far from over.

🚨Good news! After my colleagues and I sent a letter urging the Biden Administration to have Medicare cover COVID-19 rapid tests, I'm pleased to see Medicare or Medicare Advantage beneficiaries will be able to receive 8 free over-the-counter tests per month starting this spring. https://t.co/bCm1A3mwM7

This is why I urged @POTUS upon entering office to #FireDeJoy by removing and replacing his enablers on the USPS Board. No one should be surprised that the Trump loyalist in charge of the Postal Service is now attacking good paying union jobs and worsening the climate crisis. https://t.co/0Quw6td747

Today, @POTUS dealt a serious blow to ISIS that will damage their ability to regroup, and the US sent a strong message that we will remain steadfast in the fight to stop the spread of terrorism while staying vigilant in hunting down those who’ve harmed Americans. https://t.co/RpptlfBUmW

We are seeing consistent patterns of anti-Semitic hate across our nation—and it has to stop.

My heart goes out to Chicago's Jewish community and I thank local authorities for their diligence in responding.
https://t.co/jqu3uwwHfl

This pandemic is not over.
 
Get your vaccines and boosters👉https://t.co/4Hmb8dJOrL
 
Get tested👉https://t.co/pClfQfaKXf

When disaster strikes, moms should not be left scrambling to feed their babies. Proud to join @RepUnderwood in sponsoring our bill to help ensure that nursing parents can access FEMA assistance to replace breastfeeding equipment damaged during disasters. https://t.co/mICw53Wwt4

The Brandon Road Lock and Dam in Joliet, Illinois, is just one example of how the Bipartisan Infrastructure Deal is already at work helping Illinoisans, creating jobs and improving our lives for years to come. https://t.co/iyDapi49gH
I encourage everyone to take a moment to learn more about the symptoms of strokes. Every minute counts—and knowing the signs could save your life👉https://t.co/jQ0JLbAUK9
Sending my best to my friend @SenatorLujan and his family. I'm relieved to hear he will make a full recovery and look forward to having him back with us in the Senate soon. https://t.co/TlF570kAxi

David Richmond.
Franklin McCain.
Ezell A. Blair, Jr.
Joseph McNeil.

Today, we honor the Greensboro Four who, during the Woolworth sit-in, showed true bravery in the face of racial injustice and taught us the power of peaceful protest. https://t.co/h9mNTHIPuc

Happy Lunar New Year! With 2022 bringing us the #YearOfTheTiger—which symbolizes strength, bravery and confidence—I am hopeful for the year to come after two years of violent hate against the AANHPI community. I wish all who celebrate a happy, healthy and prosperous new year. https://t.co/Bu1JkfPrRg

Throughout #BlackHistoryMonth, we honor the countless Black leaders, trailblazers and activists who demanded justice and brought us closer to true equality even while so many in power tried to drag us backwards.

Now and always, Black history is American history. https://t.co/RYAtSd6c01

. @TheJusticeDept should examine and pursue any well-founded civil rights violations related to the murder of Laquan McDonald 7 years ago. The communities impacted by police violence—and the loved ones of its victims—deserve accountability and justice.

I’m extremely troubled that Jason Van Dyke is set to be released this week. As a mother, my heart breaks for Laquan McDonald's family’s tragic loss and the years they have fought for justice. As a human, I know he and his family deserved better.
As we mark the day that the first @SocialSecurity check was issued in 1940, we recommit ourselves to building on this hard-earned benefit and never ever ever ever ever tearing it down.

Two years ago, my constituent and Navy Veteran Mark Frerichs was abducted in Afghanistan.

To this day, he is still not reunited with his family at home.

I haven't forgotten Mark. And neither have his loved ones.

We must continue to do everything we can to #BringMarkHome.

The troubling pattern of first responder roadside deaths demands action and I'm proud that the Administration is answering the call by including parts of @SenatorDurbin and my bill in their new National Roadway Safety Strategy to reduce risks and save lives. https://t.co/22Lsp6X3QL

Congrats to Illinoisan Geri Aglipay on your appointment to lead @SBAgov Region 5! I’m proud of the work you’ve done to support diverse entrepreneurs in Illinois & across the Midwest, & I look forward to continuing our work together to help support small businesses in the region.
Thank you, Lily, for sharing your powerful story with our younger generations and all of us so we #NeverForget. https://t.co/9act2Nvfiy

Thrilled to see @EPAMichaelRegan and the Biden Admin taking further action to address generations of environmental injustices against Black, Brown and low-income communities across our nation.

Environmental justice can't wait—we must do better.
https://t.co/Ev78qYxCF4

It's on each of us to uproot this hatred, call out Holocaust denial and do more to protect those in the Jewish community who continue to be targeted.

I'll never quit working to ensure every Jewish American can pray and live their lives free of fear.

Nearly 80 years after the liberation of Auschwitz, the hostage situation we saw in TX is yet another horrific reminder of the senseless anti-Semitism that persists today.

This shouldn’t have happened and should never happen again. But words alone won't prevent the next tragedy.

On Holocaust Remembrance Day, we pause to remember the six million Jews, and the many LGBTQ+ people, people with disabilities and others who were systematically targeted and murdered during the darkest chapter in our world's history.

In their names, we re-pledge: #NeverAgain.

Military sexual misconduct is a crisis that impacts the lives of far too many in uniform. Thank you, @POTUS, for taking action today to address sexual harassment as what it is: a serious offense that hurts our servicemembers and undermines our readiness and unit cohesion. https://t.co/F54jthdlic

Thank you for your service and your good work for the American people, Justice Breyer. I look forward to reviewing the qualifications of @POTUS's nominee and know that w/ @SenatorDurbin as @JudiciaryDems Chair, whoever the Senate confirms will help advance equal justice for all.

Read this thread! From attacks, harassment, shootings and now this—there is no shortage of ways that our Asian American community is targeted. But we will NOT be silenced.

I'm with you, @NAPAWF. All of us must work together to #StopAsianHate. https://t.co/CfvqjIicnp

BREAKING: Illinois is ranked #1 in the #Top10LEED states for certified green buildings in 2021. Thank you to everyone who is working to make a greener, more sustainable future possible in our great state. https://t.co/vExxPdcsNg

Get your vaccines.
Get your booster.
Get tested.

And together, we will get through this.

Illinois remains a shining beacon for reproductive freedom—but let's be clear: everyone, in every state, deserves to have their constitutional rights protected. It's time to codify Roe v. Wade into federal law. https://t.co/tbtJead9H1
Reminder: not a single Republican voted for the American Rescue Plan that helped deliver record job growth and a 3.9% unemployment rate.

Need to get vaccinated? Visit https://t.co/4Hmb8dJOrL.

Need to get boosted? Visit https://t.co/4Hmb8dJOrL.

Need to get a FREE at-home rapid test? Visit https://t.co/6L7fNcKM48.

Together, we will get through this.

Today marks nine years since President Obama's Department of Defense rescinded the ridiculous exclusion of women in combat.

Because, *of course* America’s daughters can defend her in combat as well as her sons.

Am I right, ladies?💪 https://t.co/P54XuiOMyF
Circling back on this! https://t.co/lWkpUBaiDy

I refuse to let my daughters grow up in a world with fewer rights than I had.

It’s time to codify Roe v. Wade into law and protect reproductive freedoms for all women—regardless of their skin color, income or zip code.

If Roe v. Wade is overturned, the consequences could be catastrophic.

Women will seek out less safe and more dangerous options to get the medical care they need.

They'll be forced to give birth before they're ready.

Women like me might not be able to have children through IVF.

Roe v. Wade rightfully put millions of women in control of their own bodies, their own careers and their own destinies. But on the 49th anniversary of this landmark victory for women everywhere, the right to choose and reproductive freedom as we know it are under attack.

Great news! Thanks to @POTUS, you can now call 800-232-0233 seven days a week to order your 4 free COVID tests. 

Request yours today and help stop the spread.
https://t.co/DgXByQjXCg

Record number of jobs created.

Unemployment rate down to 3.9%.

Hunger rate dropped by 32%.

Lowest child poverty rate ever in 2021.

This economic recovery is brought to you by Democrats and our American Rescue Plan.

This should never happen. It shouldn't matter the color of someone's skin or when their family arrived to this nation—they always should be met with respect.
https://t.co/j2na4x0GlJ
Dr. King never gave up and neither will we. I will never quit working to protect every American's right to vote. https://t.co/rvJsHSg4zT

A year into his presidency, @POTUS and Democrats have delivered:
 
👷🏽‍♂️A record-breaking year for job growth
💵Checks in pockets and shots in arms
🛣Better roads, cleaner water, faster internet
📉A 3.9% unemployment rate
💼Support for small biz
 
And we're just getting started. https://t.co/0CQ3y5Pr7B

Once again, Senate Republicans blocked our efforts to protect the right to vote. Democracies die when those in power silence the will of the people and, as someone who fought in uniform to protect and defend our Constitution, I won’t allow Republicans to make a mockery of it.

Not only *can* the Senate do more to protect the right to vote, we *have* done more—including the 16 Republicans still in the Senate today who have previously voted to reauthorize the Voting Rights Act.

C'mon, let's come together and get this done.

I’m not asking Republicans to do anything near as difficult as what John Lewis went through for our democracy.

All I’m asking for is the bare minimum.

To not sit silent in the face of a grave injustice.

To not let being partisan keep you from being a patriot.
The march forward in our nation’s history has always been to expand access to the polls: for those who didn’t own land, for Black Americans, for women—for all Americans. Tonight is no different.

My Republican colleagues: all I'm asking you to do today is to not let being partisan keep you from being a patriot. To not sit in silence while voting rights are attacked. To help us meet this moment and protect the right to vote. https://t.co/tisshsBzT7

Folks, CDC data shows that those who are unvaccinated have a 10x greater risk of getting COVID-19 and a 20x greater risk of dying from it.

Again and again, we're confirming what we knew from the start—vaccines and boosters work and save lives.

“The time is always right to do what is right.” —MLK

Today, I strongly hope my colleagues will join us on the right side of history by voting to protect the right to vote for every American.

Republicans' strategy to win future elections:

👉Block voting rights in Congress
👉Leverage the Big Lie to pass anti-voter laws nationwide

Their goal is clear: they want to shut out millions of eligible voters from our democracy.

We can't let it happen. The Senate must act.

Testing is key to overcoming this pandemic. Thank you @POTUS for making it easier for millions of Americans to access FREE at-home COVID-19 tests.

Visit https://t.co/6L7fNcKM48.

Jobs recovered from the pandemic: ⬆️ 84%
Unemployment: ⬇️ 3.9%
Applications to start a small business: ⬆️ 30% 
Jobs created: 6.4 million
 
Democrats deliver.

Dr. King taught us the true meaning of justice, the power of kindness and the importance of serving others. He died for his convictions, and now it’s on us to “make real the promises of democracy” that he spoke of.

Together, we must rebuild our democracy stronger than ever.

This #MLKDay, our mission is clear: we have a duty to honor Dr. Martin Luther King’s legacy and act against this new era of Jim Crow fueled by the Big Lie. Now is the time to pass the John Lewis VRAA and the Freedom to Vote Act to protect voting rights for every American. https://t.co/w19jPMKVMQ

When you get vaccinated, you’re not just protecting yourself—you’re protecting your loved ones and your community.

Getting vaccinated and boosted could keep you and those around you out of the hospital. It could save lives.

On this day, a hero that would go on to champion civil rights, equity and racial justice for countless people was born. As we celebrate the life of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. today, one of the best gifts we could give to further his legacy would be to protect the right to vote. https://t.co/4CaEAQeyku

We know that vaccines and booster shots help prevent serious illness from Omicron. Please, if you haven't yet, go get your (free!) shots.

Go to https://t.co/4Hmb8dJOrL to find a location near you.

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Deal is already at work helping Illinoisans, providing our state with the support it needs to repair our crumbling bridges. This will help working families across our state see shortened commute times on safer roads and save folks money every year. https://t.co/CZkCPSI9Ef

My new law, the Protecting Moms Who Served Act, will help our VA tackle the maternal health crisis and ensure all of our women Veterans—including women of color—receive the maternal care they've earned.
https://t.co/JibdonoNfv

John Lewis devoted every ounce of his being to ensuring our democracy outlived Jim Crow. Now, Republicans are making unprecedented attempts to not only block voting rights, but subvert election results.

I'm with @BarackObama. The stakes are too high for inaction. https://t.co/p3TtxxgXwM

Proud to support @NationalNurses and all healthcare workers by joining Sen. @GillibrandNY to ask the Biden Administration to move forward with a permanent, enforceable OSHA standard to protect healthcare workers on the frontlines of this pandemic. https://t.co/m1fFo1rCVO

On January 13, 1903, the first Korean immigrants arrived on our shores and have made limitless contributions to our country ever since. Today, we celebrate their achievements, re-pledge ourselves to tackling the challenges they face and wish them a very happy Korean American Day. https://t.co/mQLI0pXulZ

Over the past year, we’ve seen Mitch McConnell and Republicans leverage Donald Trump’s Big Lie about the 2020 election to block progress on voting rights and stack the deck to subvert future elections.

We can’t wait—it’s time to protect the people’s right to vote. https://t.co/9QkwIYTt2B
Retweet if you’d like to see the Senate defend our democracy and move forward on legislation to protect the freedom to vote for every American.

This is the least we can do. 
 
I hope the House passes this legislation soon so that Emmett and Mamie's names will be rightfully honored by our nation for generations to come.
https://t.co/4ILxAMAXfU

I'm grateful for the work Dr. Fauci has done to guide our nation through this crisis in the midst of Republican obstruction. Anyone who chooses to politicize science and scientists who want to save lives should be ashamed of themselves.

From day one, Dr. Fauci has been a reliable voice of public health information while Republicans downplayed a pandemic that has already killed 800K+ Americans. Now, rather than help end this crisis, they’re still pushing lies that put his life, his family and all of us at risk. https://t.co/RTF1LUmFE1

By perpetuating lies that the 2020 election was stolen, Republicans and bad faith actors across the nation are working to undermine our democracy bill by bill, law by law and state by state. They won't stop, so it's time we act to protect the right to vote for every American.

⏰Time is ticking—there are only 5 days left to sign up for coverage and save on healthcare costs in 2022. I can’t stress this enough: your health is too important to miss out on this. Visit https://t.co/Exlg5xuNqg ASAP and #GetCovered.

Why are Democrats the only ones working to protect every American’s right to vote?

Is it because Republicans think they'll lose if your voice is heard?

Is it because they have no plans to help working Americans?

And their only real plan is to stay in power, no matter the cost?

No one can predict when they'll have an accident and need life-saving care. There's only one more week to sign up for affordable healthcare insurance to make sure you're covered in 2022. 

Visit https://t.co/Exlg5xuNqg today.

Folks, unemployment is at 3.9%—an all-time low since the pandemic began. 

All thanks to Democrats and our policies that are working to ensure we emerge from this pandemic stronger than before.

Mamie Till-Mobley was a hometown hero, a national leader and maybe most of all—a loving mother. 
 
I'm heartened that the story of her push to make America better in her son Emmett Till’s memory was shown in living rooms across the country. https://t.co/mOgOqYqAyU

A year after I gave this speech, red states continue to push bill after bill to weaken our democracy and Republicans continue to spread the same lies that fomented the insurrection.

But I will not yield. Power belongs to the people.
https://t.co/bFjU1dyXuB
Delivering accountability and protecting the right to vote. That’s how we can work to move forward and rebuild our democracy stronger than before. https://t.co/3lTZct5YWa

The families of our public safety officers deserve better. 

That’s why I will introduce a bill to ensure family members receive the benefits their loved ones earned.

After the horrific trauma suffered that day, a @CapitolPolice officer and a @DCPoliceDept officer who helped fight back the insurrectionists later died by suicide. Tragically, in too many instances, those deaths aren't considered line of duty deaths.
https://t.co/tOylHEbb4w

A year ago, Capitol Police officers put their lives on the line to defend our democracy against a violent, Trump-incited insurrection. So many of them are still recovering from the wounds they sustained that day, and we can never thank them enough for their heroism. https://t.co/2KPBeREKal

What a tragic way for us to lose an Illinois hero. 

Sending my deepest condolences to Deidre’s family and loved ones. I’m grateful for the work she did to help Illinois children.

https://t.co/o4Q2kxk1rv

Now is the time to redouble our efforts to make our democracy stronger than ever before.
